Our Research

Research indicates a well-rested and supported caregiver improves patient outcomes.

Improving a Caregiver's Health

Focusing on the wellbeing of the caregiver can be key in any patients health, positively influencing emotion -- and the research shows it.

Case study

Nutrition, Nutrition, Nutrition

Every meal matters, and the only way to heal/stay healthy is to be properly fed, so that each guest can focus on what really matters during their stay.

Case study

A Good Night's Rest

Consistant sleep patterns over time become a challenge, especially when you are not in your own home. Providing a safe and quiet environment to rejouvenate in plays a huge role instead of the noise in a hospital.

Case study

Improving a Patient's Health

Commutes can make the time spent at a health facility even longer, adding on 1 - 2 hours for some patients. Staying at a Hospitality House can improve your health, and help you get better faster.

Case study

Readmission of Patients

Critical to patient and family centered care is ensuring patients have the tools they need to recover at home and avoid the need to return to the hospital.

Read More

Psychological Impact on Health

Humans are social beings who need that send of belonging and without it, there is a tendency to become depressed...

Importance of Family

The importance of families in the healing process is becoming more widely recognized around the world, with research showing their presence can be an effective tool for improving patient outcomes...
